bug.author: kingennio
bug.description: Hi I've installed chainer on a Windows 10 machine. I've set the env variables as specified in the install instruction, PATH and LD_LIBRARY_PATH but cupy fails. On cpu runs fine but not on gpu. On my machine theano works on gpu, so CUDA libs and VisualStudio dependencies are properly configured. when I run the train_ptb example I get the error C:\Users\swarm\Anaconda3\python.exe C:/Users/swarm/PycharmProjects/chainer/examples/ptb/train_ptb.py Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:/Users/swarm/PycharmProjects/chainer/examples/ptb/train_ptb.py", line 34, in xp = cuda.cupy if args.gpu >= 0 else np AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'cupy' Process finished with exit code 1 When I run setup.py, I get the exception running install running bdist_egg running egg_info writing top-level names to chainer.egg-info\top_level.txt writing requirements to chainer.egg-info\requires.txt writing dependency_links to chainer.egg-info\dependency_links.txt writing chainer.egg-info\PKG-INFO Executing cythonize() Options: {'no_cuda': False, 'linetrace': False, 'profile': False, 'annotate': False} error: [WinError 2] The system cannot find the file specified Include directories: ['C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v7.5\include', 'C:\Users\swarm\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\numpy\core\include'] Library directories: ['C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v7.5\bin', 'C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v7.5\lib\x64'] Include directories: ['C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v7.5\include', 'C:\Users\swarm\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\numpy\core\include'] Library directories: ['C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v7.5\bin', 'C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v7.5\lib\x64'] cython path:c:\users\swarm\anaconda3\lib\site-packages Process finished with exit code 1

comments.comment: Thank you for issue report. This issue will fix <denchmark-link:https://github.com/chainer/chainer/pull/647>#647</denchmark-link> .

I've just updated the project in this very moment and now launching setup.py makes some progress. It manages to compile some of the code but in the end it fails C:\Users\swarm\Anaconda3\python.exe C:/Users/swarm/PycharmProjects/chainer/setup.py install running install running bdist_egg running egg_info writing top-level names to chainer.egg-info	op_level.txt writing chainer.egg-info\PKG-INFO writing dependency_links to chainer.egg-info\dependency_links.txt writing requirements to chainer.egg-infoequires.txt Executing cythonize() Options: {'linetrace': False, 'annotate': False, 'no_cuda': False, 'profile': False} Include directories: ['C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v7.5\include', 'C:\Users\swarm\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages
